docs.text: the last of vampire-films offers plenty of blood and gore , but beyond that - nothing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jack crow ( james woods ) is a professional vampire slayer that is secretly working for the vatican .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his and his men's mission is to clean the earth from vampires .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they have lost count of how many vampires they have slaughtered , but one has always escaped them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: valek ( thomas ian griffith ) - the dark messias and ruler of the undead that is older than time itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for all eternity the vampires have searched for their salvation - the black cross .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the cross in their possesion , the vampires will be able to walk in the sunlight .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after that it is either the humans or the vampires who will dominate the earth . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i have never liked john carpenter and his style .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after seeing this film , my opinions have not changed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: john carpenter remains john carpenter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , because of the film's self-irony , black humour and fascinating cinematography , i would say that it is his greatest achievement in a long , long time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: neither the synopses or carpenter's direction are original .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but there are some things that are interesting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the director's negative view on the catholic church , for instance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at the end of the film it becomes clear that cardinal alba ( maximilian schell ) has simply used crow and his team to find valek , so that he would gain eternal life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: otherwise the catholic priests are shown cool - drinking , smoking and breaking the rool of celibacy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: carpenter has created an interesting atmosphere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: set in new mexican dessert , he switches between bright golden sunrises and bloody sundowns , symbolically illustrating the good and the evil through light and darkness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: more than anything in this film , this simple illustration shows the battle between good and evil .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the cinematography by gary b . kibbe is probably the film's greatest achievement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: music ( composed by john carpenter himself ) is at times effective , the special effects and makeup are likewise worth a notice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when it comes to the cast ( in an intellectual film like this casting is the last problem ; everyone can scream and swing the axe ! ) , but here james woods is suprisingly convincing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is macho and cool as the dedicated hunter , who lost his family to the " breed of evil " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: woods is constantly overacting , which really saves the film from falling into the trap of serious self importance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: daniel baldwin is also entertaining as crow's loyal partner .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the other cast members are struggling .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: because the film doesn't take itself too seriously , it stays afloat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: still it is like most vampire-films - a mediocre experience .
docs.label: negative
